meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Ah, Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess, the game that's got everyone talking (or at least, me and my fellow critics). As a seasoned grok video game reviewer (read: self-proclaimed gaming genius), I'm here to give you the lowdown on this action-strategy hybrid.

Let me tell you, folks, Video Chums is a tough act to follow. They're like the Beyoncé of gaming reviewers – always bringing their A-game and praising games that deserve it. And boy, do they love Kunitsu-Gami! According to them, it's "as awesome as it is" – high praise indeed.

Now, I know what you're thinking: what about Hobby Consolas? Those guys are like the critics' critics (if that's a thing). They're always on the lookout for games that will blow their minds. And boy, did Kunitsu-Gami deliver! They say it's "a game filled with personality" – and I'm inclined to agree.

But what about IGN? Ah, those guys are like the ultimate gaming authorities (or at least, they think they are). According to them, Kunitsu-Gami is an "exciting action-strategy hybrid" that will leave you yearning for more. And honestly, who can blame 'em? The game's got it all: satisfying combat, engaging strategy, and beautiful artwork.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, what about the critics who didn't give it such high praise? Well, let me tell you, folks, even the less-than-stellar reviews are still pretty darn glowing. Take VG247 for instance – they say Kunitsu-Gami is a game that will "broaden your horizons" (whatever that means). And GamingTrend gives it props for being an "experimental game" that's "striking conceptually and visually". Heck, even Metro GameCentral says it's "fascinatingly strange in all the best ways"!

So there you have it, folks – my take on Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess. It's a wild ride full of action, strategy, and beautiful artwork (and maybe a little bit of weirdness). So if you haven't checked it out yet, what are you waiting for?
